授業目的: The purpose of this IM course is to guide students towards developing a critical and practical appreciation of international management (IM) as a valid & vital, strategic response to the global business challenges and opportunities that are currently impacting on management thinking and practice in all types of organisations and across all business sectors.
到達目標:
To guide students towards achieving a critical and practical appreciation of the role of transnational corporations (TMNS) in shaping contexts for international trade and business
To enable students to demonstrate a critical and practical appreciation of processes of international management as a relevant strategic mindset and response in different types of organisation.
Note: In order to differentiate this IMC module from those offered by other international MBA programmes in Japan, we will emphasise and explore East Asian perspectives on IM.
授業方法:
Seven face-to-face class sessions.
Home study reading assignments (individual and group) with focus on a set textbook.
LUNA Discussion Forums on related class themes will be opened in between class sessions.

第1回: Week #1: International management: roles and responsibilities
第3回: Week #2: Scanning the business environment: uncertainty and risk
第5回: Week #3: International management: coordination and control
第7回: Week #4: Organisational management: differentiation and integration
第8回: Case study & textbook reading: LUNA Discussion
第9回: Week #5: Organisational leadership: diversity and conflict
第11回: Week #6: International management: emerging business challenges and opportunities
第13回: Week #7: Cross-border acquisitions: creating stakeholder value?
Group discussion: Home study reading assignment
